text: Ficus pakkensis is a species of plant in the family Moraceae, native to tropical northern South America.Pereira, J.P. et al. 1998; IUCN Red List: Ficus pakkensis . accessed 28 January 2017. It is found in Guyana, and in the states of Pará and Maranhão in northern Brazil. It is an IUCN Red List Vulnerable species. The Brazilian subpopulation is confined and declining. ==References== ==External links== * Current IUCN Red List of All Threatened Species pakkensis Category:Trees of South America Category:Endemic flora of Brazil Category:Endemic flora of Guyana Category:Flora of Pará Category:Environment of Maranhão Category:Trees of Brazil Category:Vulnerable flora of South America Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ficus pakkensis
